p: Structural modification was performed on the previous IBA based HDACI. Compounds with hydroxamic acid and hydrazide groups as ZBGs were synthesised and evaluated in the enzyme inhibitory assay and in vitro antiproliferative screening. Among the derived compounds, molecule I13 exhibited high HDAC inhibitory activity against HDAC1 (IC 50 value of 13.9 nM), HDAC3 (IC 50 value of 12.1 nM), and especially HDAC6 (IC 50 value of 7.71 nM). The in vitro antiproliferative results revealed that molecule I13 can effectively inhibit the growth of both haematologic and solid tumour cell lines. Compared with SAHA, molecule I13 showed high potency in the growth inhibition of U937, U266, HepG2, A2780, and PNAC-1 cells. In the further in vivo assay, 50 mg/kg/d of I13 can inhibit growth of xenograft tumour in athymic mice compared with 100 mg/kg/d of SAHA. Induction of apoptosis was revealed to play a role in the anticancer activity of molecule I13.The results suggested that HDACIs with high anticancer potency could be derived by further structural modification of the lead compound I13.
